item.title: In loving memory of Ashwini
item.description: This poem was written on July 4th 2011. I finally feel like it ok for the world to see this on her 4th death anniversary.

item.title: Spiritual, religious or philosophical?
item.description: Many people confuse spirituality with religiousness, and philosophy with spirituality. Here I will attempt to tease out the differences as I see them. To be religious is to follow a given set of rules generally defined by an existing system of organised faith.

item.title: Autumn dance
item.description: It is time for leaves to bid farewell to the trees they leave Where they have lived for two happy seasons Leaving is an elation

item.title: A Glimpse of Summer
item.description: Full green trees Soft summer breeze Ripe Nectarines Nectarines invite With fruity fragrance Tempt a juicy bite The grass is deep Big boys play A whiff to keep

Views on other beliefs I retain a relatively moderate view on people who take an external god literally, so long as they never cross the line of violence especially with children, nature or other cultures.

item.description: I have wondered about the concept of god all my life so far. I would like to describe and reflect on my journey so far.

item.title: Little Baby Ten Days Old
item.description: May 2008, dedicated to my niece. . Little baby 10 days old You squirm around in my lap Frown and smile without reason Pee and poo without warning

item.title: Frames of Reference
item.description: A colleague of mine is taking German lessons and when the topic of poetry came up at lunch, he described Elftans, and their structure. It reminded me a little of Haiku so I said ¨Sounds like the European version of Haiku¨.

item.title: The Woman
item.description: She is the wind you cannot capture, the fire you cannot hold, She has the strength of the earth but she flows She is a woman.

item.title: God and Love
item.description: From April 2008: Words like love and god are of the most ambiguous. What do people mean when they ask ‘do you believe in god’ or say ‘I love you’.

item.title: Path
item.description: March 2002 . From where we come, we go back But where do we go in the middle? We follow a path, A path that is not there.

item.title: It

item.title: Anger
item.description: First published in August 2008 Anger. Like a vengeful human on a leash If you were to be freed What damage, what destruction… What chaos.

item.title: Reflection
item.description: First published on October 2007 I look for my reflection I love my reflection. It isn’t me but my only companion Through life. And sometimes it is me.

item.title: Misty Night
item.description: On this misty night Trees are backlit mystically She cannot welcome Winter with any warmth Yet, when you are near The biting wind is forgiven

item.title: Pure White Snow
item.description: Winter so beautiful I renew what I knew Feel pure white snow Fresh and cold, it swirls What colour is love? What temperature is it?

item.title: Pink Powder
item.description: Green sprinkles in brown eyes This creature I meet is soft It is a child, gentle, shy Yet eager I found you, little creature, And you seem to like me Are you lost?

item.title: Today
item.description: The past and the future have converged in the present. This is an unbelievable miracle. Past lives return and the recent past becomes a dark void

item.title: Construction
item.description: What a magnificent construction This tall metal brick tower This world of common definitions Where I am the epitome of purity, Goodness, sincerity and compassion.

item.title: Ode to the Apple
item.description: Oh, Symbol of material Love, The ‘Apple’ of my eye, Your cold, mountain fragrance, Red beauty, Temptation, You are the reason for life, Knowledge, for the world’s Material existence and Humanity’s distance from god.
